link.description: The full URL to which the webpage link is pointing, e.g., http://www.example.com/foo/bar.
link.title: Link

title.description: The title of a webpage link in plain text.
title.title: Title

TASK_CRAWL_SITE.instillShortDescription: Crawling involves navigating through the website, starting from a designated page (often the homepage) and systematically following links to explore and retrieve titles and links from other pages. Please notice that the crawler will not fetch the content of the pages. If you want to scrape the content of the pages, please use the 'TASK_SCRAPE_PAGE'.

root-url.description: The root URL to scrape. All links on this page will be scraped, and all links on those pages, and so on.
root-url.title: Root URL

allowed-domains.description: A list of domains that are allowed to be scraped. If empty, all domains are allowed.
allowed-domains.title: Allowed Domains

max-k.description: Max-K specifies the maximum number of pages to return. If max-k is set to 0, all available pages will be returned, up to a maximum of 100. If max-k is set to a positive number, the result will include up to max-k pages, but no more than that.
max-k.title: Max Number of Pages

timeout.description: The time to wait for the page to load in milliseconds. Min 0, Max 60000.
timeout.title: Timeout

max-depth.description: Max Depth specifies how deep the crawler will navigate from the root URL. If max depth is set to 1, the crawler will only scrape the root URL and will not follow any links to other pages. If max depth is set to 0, the crawler will scrape all reachable pages until the total number of scraped pages reaches max-k. If both max-k and max depth are defined, the crawler will prioritize the max-k setting when determining how many pages to scrape.
max-depth.title: Max Depth

pages.description: The link and title of webpages crawled by the crawler.
pages.title: Pages

url.description: The URL of the sitemap to scrape
url.title: Sitemap URL

list.description: The list of information in a sitemap

lastmod.description: The last modified time of the webpage with ISO 8601 format
lastmod.title: Last Modified

changefreq.description: The change frequency of the webpage
changefreq.title: Change Frequency

list.title: List

TASK_SCRAPE_PAGE.instillShortDescription: Scraping involves extracting specific data from a targeted webpage by parsing its HTML structure. Unlike crawling, which involves navigating across multiple pages, scraping focuses on a single page to retrieve only the relevant information. Once the specific content is scraped, the next step is manipulating it using [jQuery](https://www.w3schools.com/jquery/jquery_syntax.asp) in a specified sequence. The sequence of jQuery filtering data will be executed in the order of only-main-content, remove-tags, and only-include-tags. Please check the [jQuery Syntax Examples](jquery-syntax-examples).

url.description: The URL to be scrape the webpage contents.
url.title: URL

include-html.description: Indicate whether to include the raw HTML of the webpage in the output. If you want to include the raw HTML, set this to true.
include-html.title: Include HTML

only-main-content.description: Only return the main content of the page by excluding the content of the tag of header, nav, footer.
only-main-content.title: Only Main Content

remove-tags.description: A list of tags, classes, and ids to remove from the output. You can use [jQuery](https://www.w3schools.com/jquery/jquery_syntax.asp) to remove data. If empty, no tags will be removed. Example: 'script, .ad, #footer'.
remove-tags.title: Remove Tags

only-include-tags.description: A list of tags, classes, and ids to include in the output. You can use [jQuery](https://www.w3schools.com/jquery/jquery_syntax.asp) to include data. If empty, all tags will be included. Example: 'script, .ad, #footer'
only-include-tags.title: Only Include Tags

timeout.description: The time to wait for the page to load in milliseconds. Min 0, Max 60000. Please set it as 0 if you only want to collect static content. Please notice that if the timeout is set a small value, the page may not be fully loaded.
timeout.title: Timeout

content.description: The scraped plain content without html tags of the webpage.
content.title: Content

markdown.description: The scraped markdown of the webpage.
markdown.title: Markdown

html.description: The scraped html of the webpage.
html.title: HTML

source-url.description: The source URL of the webpage.
source-url.title: Source URL

links-on-page.description: The list of links on the webpage.
links-on-page.title: Links on Page
